text: is a Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Manya was born in Osaka Prefecture on November 5, 1996. After graduating from Hinomoto Gakuen High School, she joined Vegalta Sendai (later Mynavi Sendai) in 2015. However, she could not play in Nadeshiko League competition for injury in 2015 and 2016 season. In 2017, she debuted in Nadeshiko League and became a regular player as left side back. In 2012, Manya was selected the Japan U-17 national team for 2012 U-17 World Cup. On July 27, 2017, she debuted for the Japan national team against Brazil. She played 7 games for Japan in 2017. ==Statistics== List of match in 2017 at Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2017 7 0 Total 7 0 ==References== ==Other websites== * *Japan Football Association Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Osaka Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Mynavi Sendai Ladies players
title: Miho Manya
